shows.title: Ancient Numerical Codes / Paranormal Investigations
shows.first_half: First Half: Development engineer Richard Heath will discuss how Stone Age astronomy and specific numbers within the time cycles of the sky influenced the various creation stories. He will show how ancient numerical codes point to a time-world in the sky largely unchanged today.
shows.second_half: Second Half: YouTuber and producer Dakota Laden will recount how his lifelong passion for filmmaking and the paranormal led him to produce his own TV show for the Travel Channel, and speak about his paranormal YouTube channel, and research of over 100 of America's most haunted sites.

shows.title: The Dark Web / Evolution of Horror
shows.first_half: First Half: Cybersecurity expert and former FBI counterterrorism operative  Eric O’Neill will discuss the extraordinary rise of the dark web. He'll share his research on the cybercriminals who now use espionage tradecraft to infiltrate our systems and steal our secrets, and he'll reveal how AI is accelerating this threat.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author, filmmaker, and teacher Chris Alexander delves into the history of the horror movie, and how it reflects the ebb and flow of our times. He'll also discuss how the genre has grown more visceral and highlight the most banned, craziest, underrated, and forgotten horror films.

shows.title: Space Weather / Halloween & Hauntings
shows.first_half: First Half: Author and Ph.D. Ramon Lopez will discuss various space-related topics, including space weather, solar storms, and the impact of planetary magnetic fields on planetary evolution and the evolution of complex life on other worlds. He will discuss the Earth's magnetic field and how solar cycles affect us here on Earth.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Psychic medium and paranormal investigator Ericka Boussarhane will speak about ghosts, hauntings, and the powerful energy that surrounds Halloween. She'll explore spooky encounters, haunted places, and why so many people experience strange things around October.

shows.title: Ouija Board Mysteries / Travis Walton Abduction
shows.guests: Karen A. Dahlman, Cheryll Jones, Travis Walton
shows.first_half: First Half: Author, counselor, and Ouija board researcher Karen A. Dahlman delves into her work and research on the Ouija board. She believes the Ouija board, often feared or sensationalized, is actually a profound gateway to higher consciousness and self-realization. The Ouija board is not dark or demonic, but rather a mirror that shows us how alive we are, she maintains.
shows.second_half: Second Half: C2C's investigative reporter Cheryll Jones presents her interview with famed alien abductee, Travis Walton. The second hour will feature Travis Walton live, along with George and Cheryll.

shows.title: Witchcraft & Magick / Ghost-to-Ghost 2025
shows.guests: Patti Negri, Melissa St. Hilaire, Open Lines
shows.first_half: First Half: Two real-life witches as well as mediums, Patti Negri and Melissa St. Hilaire will discuss the growing interest in witchcraft and magick across America, why so many people are turning to ancient practices in these uncertain times, and how these old-world ways can bring balance, empowerment, and light into even the darkest of times. They will also dive into paranormal investigations, mediumship, and the veil that separates the two worlds.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Ghost-to-Ghost 2025 is here, featuring live listener ghost stories from around the world!
